| Section8 = {{Chembox Related OtherAnions = Ammonium chloride Ammonium
| cyanide OtherCations = Tetramethylammonium hydroxide OtherCpds = Ammonia Hydroxylamine
}} }} 'Ammonia solution', also known as 'ammonium hydroxide', 'ammonia water',
'ammonical liquor', 'ammonia liquor', 'aqua ammonia', 'aqueous ammonia', or
simply 'ammonia', is a solution of ammonia in water. It can be denoted by the
symbols NH 3(aq). Although the name ammonium hydroxide suggests a base
with composition [NH 4+ ][OH â ], it is actually
impossible to isolate samples of NH 4OH, as these ions do not comprise
a significant fraction of the total amount of ammonia except in extremely dilute
solutions.
